snippet: As the government calls a program to buy mortgage-backed securities a success, a court case is a reminder of how much information is still not publicly available about that market.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column calls on Financial Industry Regulatory Authority to begin providing tracking information on opaque private mortgage-backed securities market; argues that time is ripe following precedent set in fraud case against securities trader Jesse Litvak.
lead_paragraph: As the government calls a program to buy mortgage-backed securities a success, a court case is a reminder of how much information is still not publicly available about that market.

headline.print_headline: Case Offers Peek Behind The Curtain Of a Security
headline.seo: Court Case Offers a Peek Into Mortgage Security Pricing
headline.main: Case Offers Peek Behind the Curtain of a Security
